extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to extract the true direction of an arrow

      • getArrowDirectionUnflipped

        private static OfficeDrawingReader.ArrowData.Direction getArrowDirectionUnflipped(java.util.List<org.apache.poi.ddf.EscherProperty> properties)
        Determine the raw arrow direction (i.e. whether the user added the arrow as the "start" or "end" decoration of a line) irrespective of any rotation or flipping of the drawing
        Parameters:
        properties - properties from an Escher opt record
        Returns:
        raw arrow direction

      • isSignificantEndValue

        @DomainSpecific
private static boolean isSignificantEndValue(int arrowEndValue)
        Checks if the given end value can be mapped to a real arrow (and is not a diamond, a dot or similar)
        Parameters:
        arrowEndValue - identifier of an arrow end as obtained from MS Word
        Returns:
        true if the given parameter refers to some form of an arrow; false otherwise
